question: Which is the most expensive city of India, according to Mercer's '2020 Cost of Living Survey'?
explanation:
According to Mercer’s ‘2020 Cost of Living Survey’, Mumbai is the most expensive city of India, for expatriates.
It is also the 60th most expensive city for expatriates globally and it ranks 19th in Asia. In India, Mumbai is followed by New Delhi (101st globally) and Chennai (143rd globally). The global list was topped by Hong Kong, followed by Ashgabat of Turkmenistan. Tokyo and Zurich (Switzerland) are in the third and fourth positions, respectively.
